Tasks.Task Description: Identify the goals and requirements for the IoT solution, including device types, data collection needs, and integration points.
Choose an appropriate IoT Central application template based on the project requirements, such as retail, healthcare, or energy.
Provision a new IoT Central application in the Azure portal, specifying the application name, region, and pricing plan.
Define device templates to model the devices that will connect to IoT Central, including telemetry, properties, commands, and cloud properties.
Configure device connectivity settings, including IoT Hub integration, device provisioning, and connection strings.
Enable security features such as device authentication, data encryption, and role-based access control (RBAC) for the IoT Central application.
Set up integrations with external systems, such as Azure Logic Apps, Power BI, or third-party APIs, for data visualization and automation.
Set up monitoring and alerting for device health, telemetry thresholds, and application performance using IoT Central's built-in tools.

Tasks.Task: Test Device Connectivity and Data Flow
Tasks.Task Description: Perform end-to-end testing to ensure devices can connect to IoT Central and send telemetry data successfully.
Create detailed documentation for the IoT Central application setup, including device templates, connectivity settings, and security configurations.
Conduct training sessions for the operations team on managing and troubleshooting the IoT Central application and connected devices.
Ensure the IoT Central application complies with relevant regulations and standards. Set up auditing procedures to verify compliance.
Continuously monitor the connectivity status of IoT devices registered in Azure IoT Central. Investigate and resolve any connectivity issues promptly.
Verify the security settings of IoT devices, including device authentication methods and encryption protocols. Ensure compliance with organizational security policies.
Schedule and deploy firmware updates to IoT devices to ensure they are running the latest software versions and security patches.
Perform regular audits of data transmitted by IoT devices to ensure accuracy and integrity. Address any discrepancies or anomalies.
Analyze device performance metrics and optimize configurations to improve efficiency and reduce latency.
Test failover mechanisms to ensure IoT devices can recover and reconnect in case of service disruptions.
Regularly review and update user access permissions to IoT Central to ensure only authorized personnel have access.
Create backups of IoT device configurations and store them securely to facilitate recovery in case of data loss.
Ensure all operational procedures, device configurations, and troubleshooting guides are up-to-date and accessible.
Conduct drills to prepare for potential security incidents or IoT device outages. Ensure the team is familiar with response protocols.
Evaluate Azure IoT Central's performance against the agreed SLA metrics. Address any deviations or issues.
Develop and execute plans for scaling IoT device deployments as needed. Ensure minimal disruption during scaling activities.
Ensure the operations team participates in regular training to stay updated with new IoT Central features, best practices, and security measures.
Gather feedback from users regarding IoT Central's performance and reliability. Implement improvements based on this feedback.
